meanings.definition: To examine for the purpose of noting similarities and differences.
meanings.sent1: I will compare the two books to see which one is longer.
meanings.sent2: It is important to compare prices before making a purchase.
meanings.sent3: I tried to compare my cat to a lion, but she just purred.
meanings.sent4: Her beauty could compare to a blooming rose in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a Venn diagram to help us compare the two stories.

meanings.definition: To be worthy of comparison; bear comparison.
meanings.sent1: His artwork can compare to that of famous painters.
meanings.sent2: The new restaurant can compare with the best in town.
meanings.sent3: I thought my singing could compare, but then the cat started howling.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed can compare to a roaring river.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's speed could compare to a cheetah on the hunt.
